intro: Haplopappus wardii, commonly known as the Ward's narrowleaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Haplopappus wardii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators in its native habitat.
